summary:
USER_CONTEXT: Investigating Sphinx autodoc issue where type aliases aren't applied when autodoc_typehints='description' - type hints should use configured aliases in parameter descriptions

TASK_TRACKING: 
COMPLETED: Environment setup and code exploration
- Located Sphinx codebase in /tmp/tmpf25j40i4/sphinx/
- Identified key files: sphinx/ext/autodoc/typehints.py, sphinx/ext/autodoc/__init__.py, tests/test_ext_autodoc_configs.py
- Found test case showing expected behavior with autodoc_type_aliases configuration
- Located target test module with type alias definitions (myint = int)

PENDING: 
- Analyze record_typehints() function in typehints.py to identify the bug
- Check if stringify functions need type_aliases parameter
- Create reproduction script to demonstrate the issue
- Implement fix to pass type_aliases to stringify functions
- Test the fix and create PR

CURRENT_STATE: 
- Sphinx version 3.4.0 environment ready
- Test framework has dependency issues but code analysis possible
- Found signature() function accepts type_aliases parameter in sphinx.util.inspect

CODE_STATE:
- Key files: sphinx/ext/autodoc/typehints.py (record_typehints function), sphinx/ext/autodoc/__init__.py
- Test file: tests/test_ext_autodoc_configs.py (test_autodoc_type_aliases)
- Target module: tests/roots/test-ext-autodoc/target/annotations.py (myint = int alias)

TESTS: Test framework has dependency issues, need alternative approach

CHANGES: None yet

DEPS: sphinx.util.inspect.signature() accepts type_aliases parameter

VERSION_CONTROL_STATUS: Working in cloned Sphinx repository
